titles.en: Chapter 58 – Meat of the cow and its fat
Chapter 59 – Meats of the sacrificial camels and the strutting (racing) camels

titles.ar: باب فَضْلِ لَحْمِ الضَّأْنِ عَلَى الْمَعْزِ
titles.en: Chapter 57 – Preference of meat of the lamb over the goat

titles.ar: باب لَحْمِ الْبَقَرِ وَ شُحُومِهَا
titles.en: Chapter 58 – Meat of the cow and its fat

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/131)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ عَبَّادٍ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ أَبِي الْوَرْدِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ شَكَوْا إِلَى مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) مَا يَلْقَوْنَ مِنَ الْبَيَاضِ فَشَكَا ذَلِكَ إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فَأَوْحَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ إِلَيْهِ مُرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا لَحْمَ الْبَقَرِ بِالسِّلْقِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ali Bin Al Hassan Al Maysami, from Suleyman Bin Abbad, from Isa Bin Abu Al Warad, from Muhammad Bin Qays,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The Children of Israel complained to Musa<sup>asws</sup> of what they were facing from the whiteness (vitiligo). So he<sup>as</sup> took that complaint to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic, so Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Revealed unto him<sup>as</sup>: “Order them to eat the meat of the cow with the beet’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya Ali ibn al-Hassan al-Mithamiy, from Sulayman ibn ‘Abbad, from ‘Isa ibn abu af-Ward from Muhammad ibn Qays who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that the Israelites complained before Musa, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, against illness of whiteness (albinism) and he (Moses) complained before Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, and Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, sent him revelation that said, ’Command them to eat cow meat with (white) beets.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/131)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ الْمُبَارَكِ أَرَاهُ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ أَبِي الصَّبَّاحِ الْكِنَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Yahya Bin Al Mubarak, reporting from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Abu Al Sabbah Al Kinany,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The broth of the meat of the cow does away with the whiteness (vitiligo)’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Yahya ibn al-Mubarak saw it to be from ‘Abd Allah ibn Jabalah from abu al-Sabbah al-Kinaniy who has said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ’Broth of cow meat expels whiteness (Albinism) illness.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/131)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ أَبِي زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: أَلْبَانُ الْبَقَرِ دَوَاءٌ وَ سُمُونُهَا شِفَاءٌ وَ لُحُومُهَا دَاءٌ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Ismail Bin Abu Ziyad,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The milk of the cow is a medicine, and its butter is a healing, and its meat is an ailment’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Khalid from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from ’Isma‘il ibn abu Ziyad who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Cow milk and ghee (or fat) are cures but their meat is illness.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/132)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ بَكْرٍ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ اللَّحْمُ يُنْبِتُ اللَّحْمَ وَ مَنْ أَدْخَلَ فِي جَوْفِهِ لُقْمَةَ شَحْمٍ أَخْرَجَتْ مِثْلَهَا مِنَ الدَّاءِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, form Ali Bin Hassan, from Musa Bin Bakr who said,
‘I heard Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The meat builds the meat, and the one who enters inside him a morsel of fat, throws out the likes of it from the ailments’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ali ibn Hassan from Musa ibn Bakr who has said the following: “I once heard abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, saying, ‘Meat grows meat, but if one sends a morsel of shahm (fat) inside it expels the same amount of illness out.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/132)

parts.text: أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُوقَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: مَنْ أَكَلَ لُقْمَةَ شَحْمٍ أَخْرَجَتْ مِثْلَهَا مِنَ الدَّاءِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abu Nasr, from Hammad Bin Usman, from Muhammad Bin Sowqat,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who eats a morsel of fat, throws out the likes of it from the ailments’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn abu Nasr from Hammad ibn ‘Uthaman from Muhammad ibn Sawqah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If one eats a morsel of shahm (fat) it expels the same amount of illness out.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/132)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ بَلَغَ بِهِ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ الشَّحْمَةُ الَّتِي تُخْرِجُ مِثْلَهَا مِنَ الدَّاءِ أَيُّ شَحْمَةٍ هِيَ قَالَ هِيَ شَحْمَةُ الْبَقَرِ وَ مَا سَأَلَنِي يَا زُرَارَةُ عَنْهَا أَحَدٌ قَبْلَكَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from one of his companions, having delivered with it by Zurara who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! The fat which throws out the likes of it from the ailments, which fat is it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is fat of the cow, and O Zurara, no one has asked me about it before you’.
en.sarwar: 6. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn ‘Abd Allah from certain persons of his people (and) brought by Zurarah who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ‘I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause, ‘Al-Shahmah (the fat) that expels the same amount of illness, which shahmah is it?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is shahmah of al-Baqar (cow) and no one before you has asked me about it.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/132)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ عَنْ يَحْيَى بْنِ مُسَاوِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: السَّوِيقُ وَ مَرَقُ لَحْمِ الْبَقَرِ يَذْهَبَانِ بِالْوَضَحِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin ZIyad, from Muhammad Bin Ismail Bin Bazie, from Yahya Bin Masour,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7th Imam<sup>asws</sup>) having said: ‘Al-Suweyq and the broth of the meat of the cow (beef soup), both do away with (remove)  the vitiligo’.
en.sarwar: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il ibn Bazi‘ from Yahya ibn Musawir who has said the following: “Abu Ibrahim, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, sawiq and broth of cow meat remove al-Bars (Albinism) illness.’”
